contentrichtext.text: {{Coord|42.252858|-71.000739|display=title}} ''This article is for the school in Massachusetts. For other schools with the same name see [[Quincy High School]].'' {{Refimprove|date=February 2009}} {{Infobox Secondary school | motto = Think Work Share | name = Quincy High School | logo = [[Image:QHSHAT.PNG|Quincy Presidents Hat|200px]] | established = 1924 | Principal = Frank C. Santoro | city = [[Quincy, Massachusetts|Quincy]] | state = [[Massachusetts|MA]] | country = [[USA]] | campus = [[Urban area|Urban]] | type = [[Public school (government funded)|Public]] | grades = 9-12 | students = 1,329 | nickname = Presidents | mascot = "The Pony" A plaster copy of "Appeal to the Great Spirit" by Cyrus Dallin | colors = Blue and White {{colorbox|blue}}{{colorbox|white}} | website = [http://quincypublicschools.com/qhs/ Quincy High School] }} '''Quincy High School''' ('''QHS''') is a [[Public school (government funded)|public]] [[secondary school]] located on Coddington Street in [[Quincy, Massachusetts|Quincy]], [[Massachusetts]]. It doubles as one of two high schools in the city of Quincy and as the vocational center. Quincy's mascot is known as the 'Presidents' and their school colors are Blue & White. ==History== Quincy High School was founded in the mid-nineteenth century and moved to its current location in 1924.{{Citation needed|date=February 2009}} [[North Quincy High School]] was established at a separate location in 1926.{{Citation needed|date=February 2009}} QHS construction was completed in 2010. Over the first year, Quincy High School has gotten many leaks in the pipes and has replaced. There are three wings with three floors. The A, B, and C-wing. The C-Wing is known as the Foreign Language wing on the third floor. The D-Wing on the third floor is the 'Freshman Wing". The entire A-Wing is the Math, Science and Technology room. QHS offers freshmen a seminar program called Freshman Seminar which allows freshmen to observe and do activities with a major for the upcoming years. The program is around 2â€“6 weeks rotating turns with different majors from different fields, "Business" to "Technology". Unlike NQHS, QHS offers more classes in non-academic classes. Since the school was opened, over 450 new freshmen arrived at the new school, when there was around 1,300 students in 2009-2010. ==Academics== Quincy's academic program consists of normal academic classes as well as a vocational program. ===Academic classes=== Academic classes are offered in standard, honors, advanced, and some AP level. They include: *English *Foreign Languages (Spanish, French, Italian, Mandarin, and Latin) *The Heritage Program *Science *Social Studies *Math *Health *Physical Education *The Arts ===Career and trade=== Career electives are offered in subjects such as: *Automotive *Carpentry *Communications *Culinary Arts *Electrical *Engineering *Information Technologies *Graphic Arts *Business Tech *Health and Human Services *Metals *Plumbing *Protective Services *Broadcasting Technology [Channel 22] *Computer Skills''' ==Athletics== [[Image:QHS and voc tec.jpg|right|thumb|300px|The original building of Quincy High School; the new school is to the right of the photo, in the place of the now-demolished Vocational Center depicted.]] Quincy is part of the Patriot League, and previously competed in the Atlantic Coast League (A.C.L). Its rival school is [[North Quincy High School]], which faces Quincy High in the annual Thanksgiving football game at [[Veterans Memorial Stadium]]. Despite the rivalry, Quincy High's track, crew, girls' hockey, swimming, rugby and sailing teams are joined with North's. ==Clubs and organizations== *Academic Decathlon Team *Band *Foreign Language Honor Society *Peer Education *Student Council *Drama Club *Computer Club *Concert Choir [http://www.quincyhighschoolchoir.com] *Debate Club *Literary Magazine *National Honor Society *Spanish Club *United Nations Club *Yearbook *Science Honor Society *Docents Club *Bilingual Student Council *Math Club *Robotics Team *Video Club *Spectrum (Gay/Straight Alliance) ==Notable alumni== *[[Ruth Gordon]] - Actress{{cn|reason=need a citation tying her to the school|date=June 2013}} ==References== {{Reflist}}<!--added above External links/Sources by script-assisted edit--> ==External links== *[http://quincypublicschools.com/qhs/ Official website] *[http://www.quincypublicschools.com Quincy Public Schools] [[Category:Education in Quincy, Massachusetts]] [[Category:Schools in Norfolk County, Massachusetts]] [[Category:Public high schools in Massachusetts]]
